abstracts.cdata!:
The closing date for Philippines'
            additional financing for the Second Agrarian Reform
            Communities Development Project is requested to be extended
            from June 30, 2010 until December 31, 2010. The
            recently-concluded implementation review mission (April
            2010) has confirmed the continued satisfactory
            implementation progress of the project. Overall physical
            accomplishment of the original and additional financing loan
            is reported at 98 percent, with an elapsed time of 96
            percent, based on the revised closing date of June 30, 2010.
            The remaining critical activities consist of eleven
            infrastructure subprojects funded mostly under the US$10
            million additional financing. Four of these subprojects
            would not be completed by the closing date of June 30, 2010.
            This has occurred due to delays in the release of funds from
            the Central Government which affected implementation of
            physical works. The extension is necessary to complete the
            remaining eleven irrigation subprojects. The
            Government's various implementing organizations have
            agreed on specific catch-up plans to ensure completion of
            the subprojects during the extension period. This will be
            the first extension of the project.
